comments:
Our product has a bad contributor to the CommonNavigator at the moment.  Unfortunately, it keeps the Common Navigator view from coming up.  Could you please harden SafeDelegateTreeContentProvider.dispose() against an IllegalAccessError?

Here is most of the stack trace:

Another user has reported a similar error on the inputChanged() method as well. This should be hardened there also.

Created an attachment (id=40367)
Wraps calls to dispose() and inputChanged() in SafeRunners.
Jeff and Mike -- could you take a quick look? I'd like this to make it into the Platform/UI contribution for RC3. The fix ensures that client code runs in SafeRunners at two potential weak points.
I don't have time to look at this until late this afternoon. Adding KH as an alternate.
+1 to fixing the navigator to deal with problems in client code.
